title: watcher: Fix memory leak in filePositions map
description:
The filePositions map tracks read positions for every file ever opened but never cleans up entries for files that no longer exist.

In long-running processes, this map grows indefinitely.

Fix: Periodically clean up entries for non-existent files.

Ref: watcher.go:40, 368-370

title: watcher: Fix race condition on sessions map
description:
The sessions map is accessed concurrently without synchronization:
- watchLoop() reads from w.sessions
- checkForNewSessions() writes to w.sessions
- Both run in separate goroutines with no mutex protection

Fix: Add sync.RWMutex to Watcher struct and protect all sessions map access.

Ref: watcher.go:228-246, 251-286

title: tui: Session list (-l) includes agent files as sessions
description: The ListSessions function in watcher.go returns agent JSONL files (agent-*.jsonl) as separate sessions. They should be filtered out since they're subagent logs within a session, not standalone sessions.
close_reason: Fixed - added filter for agent-prefixed files in listSessionsFiltered()

title: watcher: Extract duplicated session filtering logic
description:
The same filtering logic for session files is duplicated 4 times in:
- findSession
- discoverActiveSessions  
- checkForNewSessions
- listSessionsFiltered

Fix: Extract to isMainSessionFile() helper function.

Ref: watcher.go:104-108, 188-193, 259-263, 398-403

title: tui: Explore optional TV-themed UI
description:
Investigate a retro TV/CRT aesthetic for the TUI as an optional theme. Could include:
- Scan lines effect
- CRT curvature/vignette on borders
- Phosphor glow on text
- Static/noise effects for loading states
- Channel-switching animation when toggling sessions
- 'Tuning' effect when new content arrives
- Retro color palette (green phosphor, amber, etc.)

This would be an optional --tv or --retro flag to enable the theme.

title: stream: Fix truncation message showing 0 lines
description:
The truncation message incorrectly calculates remaining lines:

lines = lines[:s.maxLines]
lines = append(lines, fmt.Sprintf('... (%d more lines)', len(lines)-s.maxLines))

After truncating, len(lines) equals s.maxLines, so the result is always 0.

Fix: Store original count before truncating.

Ref: stream.go:217-220

title: watcher: Add context propagation for graceful shutdown
description:
The watcher is initialized without a context, making graceful shutdown difficult. The goroutine runs until Stop() is called, but if the TUI crashes, the goroutine may leak.

Fix: Pass context through initialization and use it in watchLoop.

Ref: model.go:67-86, watcher.go

title: parser: Handle errors instead of ignoring them
description:
Several errors are silently ignored:
1. Timestamp parsing (line 94) - results in zero-value timestamps
2. JSON unmarshal in formatToolInput (line 192) - uses zero values

Fix: Add proper error handling with fallbacks.

Ref: parser.go:94, 192

title: parser: Fix potential index out of bounds on agentID
description:
Code assumes agentID has at least 7 characters:
  agentName := fmt.Sprintf('Agent-%s', raw.AgentID[:7])

This will panic if agentID is shorter than 7 chars.

Fix: Use min(7, len(agentID)) like other places in codebase.

Ref: parser.go:117, 171

title: all: Extract magic numbers to constants
description:
Multiple magic numbers should be constants:
- 500ms poll interval
- 100 channel buffer size
- 5 minute active window
- 1000 max stream items
- 50 max lines per item

Fix: Define named constants for all magic numbers.

Ref: watcher.go:61,64,70, stream.go:37,59

title: watcher: Fix race condition on Subagents map
description:
The session.Subagents map is modified by checkForNewSubagents() while being read by readSessionFiles().

Fix: Add mutex to Session struct or copy map before iteration.

Ref: watcher.go:289-308, 311-318
